seriesJson.title: The American journal
seriesJson.description: This is an informal, "magazine" style interview series on the fine arts.

node.title: American spokesman, part 2
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, asks who serves as the unofficial American spokesman in the 1960s? It also includes various theater and poetry performances.

node.title: American spokesman, part 1
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, asks who serves as the unofficial American spokesman in the 1960s?

node.title: American music and writing, part 1
node.description: This program focuses on the state of American music, writing, and creativity. Features speakers include Norman Carroll, Carl Ernst, Ken Kesey, and Lotte Lehmann.

node.title: American music and writing, part 2
node.description: This program focuses on the state of American music, writing, and creativity. Features speakers include Ken Kesey, and James T. Carroll.

node.title: Theatre and poetry, part 2
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, includes an interview with Louis Sullivan about poetry.

node.title: Theatre and poetry, part 1
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, includes several interviews about acting.

node.title: Writing, part 1
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, features interviews about writing with Rod Serling, Art Buchwald, John Ciardi.

node.title: Writing, part 2
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, features interviews about writing with John Ciardi and Martin Luther King, Jr.
